resumen.descripcion: New-generation coastal circuit (~4.3 km, 17 turns) embedded in the Mandalika tourism district. Fast sweepers, linked technical sections and a beach backdrop. MotoGP venue since 2022.
BIZAM (LOP) is the practical gateway to south Lombok: ~20–30 min to Kuta/Mandalika via the airport bypass. Daily flights to Jakarta and Bali, with straightforward international links.
Hillside boutique cluster with clean lines, privacy and open Indian Ocean views. Quick access to Kuta and Tanjung Aan—solid base for quality lodging and experiences.
Active volcano (3,726 m) and the north’s big icon. Classic 2–4 day trek to the crater rim and Segara Anak lake. Permits, quotas and weather closures apply—check status before going.

photo.caption: Mount Rinjani National Park

resumen.descripcion: Car-free trio: Trawangan is lively, Air is chill and local, Meno stays quiet. Reef and turtles close to shore. Access by fast boat from Bali or by local boats from Bangsal (Lombok).

photo.alt: Beach and reef in the Gili Islands
photo.caption: Gili Trawangan · Gili Air · Gili Meno

resumen.descripcion: Wide horseshoe bay with fine sand and forgiving waves—perfect for first surf lessons. Beach warungs, board rental and sunbeds; ~25–40 min by road from Kuta.
Two turquoise coves great for bathing and paddle close to shore. Short hike to Bukit Merese for a classic Lombok sunset—just 10–15 minutes from Kuta.

photo.caption: Tanjung Aan · Bukit Merese

resumen.descripcion: Twin jungle waterfalls reached from Senaru via a signed path (ticketed; local guides optional). Slippery when wet—wear shoes with good grip.

photo.alt: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep waterfalls
photo.caption: Sendang Gile & Tiu Kelep

resumen.descripcion: Secluded bay with pinkish sand from coral fragments. Best tones ~11:00–15:00 with high sun and calm sea. Rough road (4×4 helps) or boat access; very basic services.

photo.alt: Pink sand and turquoise waters at Pink Beach
photo.caption: Pink Beach (Pantai Tangsi)

resumen.descripcion: Historic west-coast strip with hotels, beach clubs and the coastal temple Pura Batu Bolong. Famous sunsets and handy base for Bangsal (Gili boats) and Mataram.
